thread.title: Italian village torn apart by slow-moving landslide - BBC News
thread.title_full: Italian village torn apart by slow-moving landslide - BBC News

title: Italian village torn apart by slow-moving landslide - BBC News
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device Italian village torn apart by slow-moving landslide 22 February 2017 Last updated at 21:47 GMT 
Thirty-three homes have been evacuated and nearly 100 people left homeless by a landslide which is tearing apart the village of Ponzano in Italy. 
Officials say a hill has been cut in two, and the landslide is moving at a rate of a metre a day. 
The village is in the Abruzzo region, which was hit by a string of earthquakes in 2016. Related Topics
